column5: Any reports from gullrock lake? This lake use to be very popular on this board but has to seemed to have calmed down a bit the last few years. I am going this year up there but have missed the past 3 years up there to do a career move. Thanks.
We were there last year, lots of fish, not a lot of big ones. Apparently there was a smelt die off a few years ago in Red Lake. We still were happy with out trip though.

I will be making my 17th trip to Gullrock on June 17. I didn't make the trip last summer, but was there two years ago and found it in good shape.I think the conservation practices have served everyone well over the years.I cannot imagine that this year will be anything short of another great trip, but I would also be interested in hearing any reports!We pull out for Canada in 25 days . . . but who is counting?Good luck!
talked to my friends who have been on the lake for a week now, the fish are biting and they are having no problem catching big fish and good quantities. just wish i had my boat in the water.
